question.title: Trying to create an Android library in android studio
question.body:
To do this, I follow what is shown here. Unfortunately, when I select "Build", "Generate App bundles or APKS" then "Generate APK", nothing happens.

No run configuration is defined but I don't see the possibility to generate a library among the list displayed when I try to create a new one.

What am I doing wrong?

answers.body:
What you’re running into is expected behavior since an Android Library module does not generate an APK or App Bundle, it generates an .AAR file (Android Archive).

  • APKs are installable apps.

  • AARs are reusable libraries.

  1. Check that you created a Library module

    • In Android Studio: File > New > New Module > Android Library

    • In build.gradle, you should see:

      apply plugin: 'com.android.library'

  2. Build the library AAR

    • Run Gradle task:

      ./gradlew :your-lib-module:assembleRelease

      or from Android Studio: Build > Make Project.

    • Output:

      your-lib-module/build/outputs/aar/your-lib-module-release.aar

  3. Use it inside the same project

    • If you have an app module in the same project, just add a dependency:

      implementation project(":your-lib-module")

  4. Use it in another project

    • Copy the generated .aar into libs/ of your other app project, then:

      implementation files('libs/your-lib-module-release.aar')

    • Or publish to a Maven repo (local or remote) and depend on it like:

      implementation "com.example:yourlib:1.0.0"

      Happy coding.....

question_comments.body: The module build task generates all flavor AAR; or eg. bundleReleaseAar.

Library projects don't create APKs on their own. They create, well, libraries. If this is for use only within the same overall project – e.g., if you have a separate app module in the same project – you just need to select and build the module that is using the library. Otherwise, you need to publish it in order to be able to use it externally. What's your intended use?
